intro: Laburnum spinosum, commonly known as the yellow chain tree, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its long, drooping clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has compound leaves composed of several oval-shaped leaflets. Its slender, spiny stems are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance. Laburnum spinosum is also notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its preference for full sun.
